Dating: LATE PERIOD (not before); PTOLEMAIC PERIOD (not after)
Name: Sarcophagus of an eel
Description: This bronze object, which was part of the Leopold II collection, constitutes a sarcophagus of an eel. The sacred animal of the heliopolitan god Atum extends all of his length on a long rectangular base which served as a coffin. It embodied the original and aquatic state of the  creator god and his apparition on earth. The piece dates from the Late Period or from the Ptolemaic Period.
